2005T0803-d-08-30-05-BB.Narrative: Z 79930 WAS EASTBOUND ON THE MAIN TRACK AT MILEPOST CA 147.0 WEST OF THE TOWN OF LOUISA. AT THIS POINT, THERE IS A SLIGHT CURVE TO THE RIGHT. AT MP CA 146.8, CAR CSXT 292556 (2ND OUT CAR) HAD WHEELS R1, R2, L1, AND L2 LEAVE THE RAIL ON THE OUTER RAIL OF THE CURVE. THE WHEELS PROCEEDED ON THE GROUNDFOR 2112 FEET BEFORE THE TRAIN CREW SAW THE PROBLEM AND STOPPED THE TRAIN. THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS OPERATING LONG HOOD FORWARD; THE CONDUCTOR WAS ASSISTING THE ENGINEER BY CHECKING 2 PUBLIC GRADE CROSSINGS(WHICH WERE FLASHERS ONLY) FOR VEHICLES. 192661-d-08-07-05-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT GP21-07 PULLED CT14 OUT OF THE BOWL AND WAS SHOVING A TOTAL OF 37 CARS (NOT TIED ON TO) TOWARD D8, WHICH WAS CLEAR. AFTER MOVEMENT HAD STARTED INTO D8 THE CONDUCTOR WALKED OVER TO THE TIN BUILDING AND GOT THE NEXT LIST AND THEN WALKED TOWARD THE SWITCH AT D-9-6 X-OVER ON THE NORTH PULLBACK LEAD. HE WAS GOING TO RE-ALIGN THIS SWITCH FOR ANOTHER CREW TO COME OUT OF THE BOWL.  POD WAS A FEW FEET WEST OF THE SWITCH POINTS ON THE D-9-6 X-OVER ON THE NORTH PULLBACK LEAD, FOUND DISTINCT MARKS ON THE SOUTH SWITCH POINT,  WHICH INDICATE SWITCH WAS THROWN UNDER THE ENGINE CAUSING IT TO TAKE TWO ROUTES.  DETERMINED THE TRACK WAS RELINED IN THE MIDDLE OF ENGINE. SOO 2032 ENTIRELY ON THE GROUND AND LEANING TOWARD THE NORTH AND ON SWITCH #843 - THE NORTH CROSSOVER SWITCH,  AND NEXT CAR (ABOX52367) ON TIPPED RAIL. DURING THE COURSE OF RERAILING SOO 2032, HULCHER PUNCTURED FUEL TANK AT APPROXIMATELY 18:30 HOURS 8/7/05 SPILLING APPROXIMATELY 300 GALLONS OF FUEL.

192843-d-08-18-05-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT 589-18 TRAVELING IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION, STRUCK A SEMI TRUCK TRAVELING IN A NORTHWARD DIRECTION AT MP 335.22 (WINONA STREET). TRAIN CREW NOTICED TRACTOR TRAILER WITH AN EMPTY FLAT BED STOPAT THE CROSSING THEN PROCEED. TRAIN IMPACTED VEHICLE AT ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF THE EMPTY FLAT BED TRAILER.  NO INJURY TO TRAIN CREW, SEMI TRUCK DRIVER TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITAL. CROSSING PROTECTED BY CROSSBUCKS, STOP SIGNS AND ADVANCE WARNING.

192748-d-08-12-05-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 412-11  SOUTHBOUND DERAILED 79TH AND 80TH CAR IN TRAIN AT MP 671 FML AT 1105 HRS. SUBSEQUENT INVESTIGATION SHOWED THAT THE TWO CARS WERE UPRIGHT AND DAMAGE DONE TO TRACK STRUCTURE AND SWITCHES AT STEAMTOWN NORTH AND SOUTH. POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS AT 667.2. THE CARS WERE DRAGGING ALONG THE EASTSIDE AND DAMAGED BOTH THE NORTH AND SOUTH LEGS OF STEAMTOWN WYE ON DELAWARE AND LACKAWANNA RAILROAD. NS TRAINMASTER AND ROADMANGER-TECH DOWNLOADED ALL POWER WITH NO ISSUES FOUND AT THIS POINT. CREW ALSO INTERVIEWED AND REPORTS THAT NO FORCES WERE EXPERIENCED. ES SERVICES DID TRACK GEOMETRY WITH RELIEF CREW. RJ CORMAN CALLED FOR RERAILING, LINE CLEARED AT 2359 HRS. DH TRAIN AND CREW, DH, TRACK DAMAGES $25000.00 AND EQUIPMENT DAMAGES $8576.00. 3RD PARTY TRACK DAMAGED $8311.20 REPAIRED BY DH.

DURING THIS TIME, THE YARD HAD BEEN EVACUATED DUE TO SAFETY CONCERNS FOR THE EMPLOYEES.
